item.title: Sebastian Linde's Site
item.description: The highly flexible website framework for Hugo with an extensible plugin mechanism. Create a beautifully simple site in under 10 minutes ðŸš€ Latest release Star

Biography Sebastian Linde is an assistant professor at the Department of Medicine, Division of Internal Medicine, at the Medical College of Wisconsin. He is also affiliated with the Center for Advancing Population Science. His research is focused on examining health disparities within the health care industry. His interests include the study of health care pricing, provider networks, hospital cost efficiency and the effects of health policy.

Do Chargemaster Prices Matter?: An Examination of Acute Care Hospital Profitability. Medical Care. Linde, S., Egede, L. E. (2022). Trends in charges and association with defaults on medical payments in uninsured Americans: a disproportionate burden in ethnic minorities - a retrospective observational study.

item.title: Recent & Upcoming Talks

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Medical College of Wisconsin: Graduate/Faculty Classes GIM Learning Academy - Health Economics (Spring 2021) CTSI-20262: Health Economics (Fall 2020; Fall 2021) Grand Valley State University: Graduate Classes ECO641: Business Economics and Strategy (Winter 2019) ECO643 & PA633: Health Economics (Winter 2018; Fall 2018; Winter 2020) Undergraduate Classes ECO312: Applied Microeconomics (Fall 2017; Fall 2018; Winter 2020) ECO343: Health Economics (Winter 2018; Fall 2019) Purdue University: Head Instructor
